Author: ConsciousAppearance
Text: There is a fuckeatingdisorders sub that has been very helpful to me on giving advice for this sort of thing.   Honestly, anxiety is going to happen. You know it. Embrace it. You're going to feel like shit for a while. Own that. It's just a feeling. It can't actually hurt you. Ignore the thoughts, block them out, distract yourself with something else (paint your nails, do a face mask, read a book, knit, crochet, do a colouring book, learn an instrument, learn a new language etc). Basically as one of my fave YouTubers (megsyrecovery) says "Feel shit & do it anyway".  I figured I already felt like shit regardless of my weight but feeling like shit at a healthier weight & using "normal" behaviour (aka no calorie counting, no purging, no overexercise) was less likely to actually kill me!   Wishing you loads of luck!
